site_url: Web page where the datasets are available.
site_name: Name of the data provider organisation.
sitemap_exists: Website blueprint to assist search engines find, crawl and index website's content.
sitemap_url: Web page where the sitemap is available.
metadata_standards: Metadata standards for a dataset are established guidelines and formats used to describe and organise information about the contents, structure, and other relevant attributes of a dataset, facilitating its discoverability, usability, and interoperability.
metadata_standards_other: Other Metadata standards separated by comma
metadata_level: Metadata may be readily available and accessible.
downloadable_status: Data files can be downloaded without logging in or making payments.
domain: High-level domains that the datasets belong to.
data_type: <dl><dt>Possible data types:</dt><dd>- Static: Data observations recorded, stored and made available as data files. These data files are typically not updated in real-time. E.g. Survey results.csv, Car sale trends.xlsx.</dd><dd>- Streaming: Data observations that are continuously generated in real-time or near real-time and not necessarily recored and stored in databases or files. These are typically made available via APIs. E.g. Telemetry data, Feeds from social networks, In-game player activity, Stock market prices.</dd><dd>- Mixed: A combination of Static and Streaming data.</dd></dl>
data_type_other: Other Data types separated by comma
data_management_system: Systems that help data portals catalogue, manage, store, publish and share data.
data_management_system_other: Other Data management systems separated by comma
data_duplication: Possibility of finding a significant number of same datasets from another source.
contact_email: Email address of the data provider organisation.
usage_rights: <dl><dt>Denotes how the data files can be obtained.</dt><dd>- Open: Available to use, free of charge, without a user account.</dd><dd>- Semi-open: Available to use, free of charge, via a free user account.</dd><dd>- Restricted: Access to the data involves an application process, possibly for reasons of security or sensitivity of the subject matter (application fees may apply).</dd><dd>- Closed: Available on a commercial basis only (whether the commercial model is a one-time fee or a subscription).</dd></dl>
usage_rights_other: Other Usage Rights separated by comma
update_frequency: <dl><dt>Frequency of updating the datasets in the data source.</dt><dd>- Once: A one-off static dataset, no updates expected.</dd><dd>- Ad hoc: Dataset updated as and when required, no fixed schedule.</dd><dd>- Within-day: Dataset updated multiple times a day.</dd><dd>- Daily: Dataset updated once a day.</dd><dd>- Weekly: Dataset updated once a week.</dd><dd>- Monthly: Dataset updated once a month.</dd><dd>- Quarterly: Dataset updated once every 3 months.</dd><dd>- Semi-annual: Dataset updated once every 6 months.</dd><dd>- Annual: Dataset updated once every 12 months.</dd></dl>
data_provider_type: Is the data provider a host, owner or both?
metadata_availability: Metadata refers to the title, description and other information about the contents, structure, and relevant attributes of a dataset that help's users understand and effectively use the dataset.
